_header: And ended my complaint in this manner
Subjects: dialogues; mutability, of world; frames, literary; madness; death, approach of; money
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘Dialogue with a Friend,’ or ‘Dialogus cum Amico,’ the second of several works in verse and prose that form Hoccleve’ Series, preceded by 235 and followed by 2621 — 118 rhyme royal stanzas.

BodSelSup53.First Lines:
And endid my compleinte in this manereDon knockid at my chaumbre
                    dore sore …
BodSelSup53.Last Lines:
…Wole I translate and that my gifte I hopeShal pourge as clene
                    as keuerchiefs dooþ sope
BodSelSup53.Attributed Title:
Explicit dialogus & incipit quedam fabula quadam bona & nobili
                        Imperatrice Romana (f. 98)
BodSelSup53.Editions:
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             English Verse between Chaucer and Surrey.
         Durham, NC: Duke UP, 1927: 69 (extract).

Bod221.First Lines:
And endith my complaynte in þys manereOne knokkid at my
                    chaumbir dore sore…
Bod221.Last Lines:
…Well I translate & þat my gilt I hopeShall purge as
                    clene as kerchiffes doth sope

BodLauMis735.First Lines:
And endid my compleynt in þis manereOne knokkid at my chaumbre
                    dore sore…
BodLauMis735.Last Lines:
…Wole I translate & þat my gilt I hoopeShall purge as
                    clene kerchefes doth soope
BodLauMis735.Attributed Title:
Here endith my compleynt & begynneth A dialoggus (f.
                    5v)

CovAcc3251.First Lines:
ANd eendid my compleint in þis manereOone knockid at my
                    chambir dore sore…
CovAcc3251.Last Lines:
…Wol I translate and þat my gelte I hopeShall purge as
                    clene as kerchief doþe soope

DULCosViii9.First Lines:
And endyd my complaynt in this manereone knocked at my chambre dore
                    sore…
DULCosViii9.Last Lines:
…Wole I translate and þat shal pourge I hopeMy gilt as
                    cleene as keuerchiefs dooth sope
DULCosViii9.Attributed Title: Dialogue cum Amico (added modern hand, f. 9)
